definitions.definition: An individual or a corporation who has the right of use of something of value, gained through a lease agreement with the real owner of the property.
The entity to whom a lease is given, or who takes an estate by lease.
Someone who is allowed to use a house, building, land etc. for a period of time in return for payment to the owner.
To speak in generalities, or in vague terms.
To infer or induce from specific cases to more general cases or principles.
To derive or deduce (a general concept or principle) from particular facts.
A twisted strand of fiber used for knitting or weaving.
Bundles of fibers twisted together, and which in turn are twisted in bundles to form strands, which in their turn are twisted or plaited to form rope.
A story, a tale, especially one that is incredible.
To tell a story or stories.
To surgically remove the foreskin (prepuce) from a penis (male).
(sometimes proscribed) To surgically remove the clitoris (clitoridectomy), clitoral hood, or labia (female).
To be vindicated; to triumph despite predicted failure; to find success after defeat or setback.
definitions.example: The author had the last laugh over the publishers who had rejected her now best-selling book.

definitions.definition: Lack of courage.
(usually childish) Father.
A male lover.
An informal term of address for a man.
definitions.example: Rock 'n' roll is cool, daddy, and you know it!

definitions.definition: A male juvenile delinquent in a reformatory who dominates the other inmates through threats and violence.
To father; to sire.
An owl of the species Tyto alba, often having a white face and commonly found in barns and other farm buildings.
The office or jurisdiction of an admiral.
The department or officers having authority over naval affairs generally.
The court which has jurisdiction of maritime questions and offenses.
The system of jurisprudence of admiralty courts.
The building in which the lords of the admiralty, in England, transact business.
The study and interpretation of behavior in terms of simple and complex reflexes.

A form of complementary medicine involving the stimulation of points on the feet, hands, or ears, in the belief that it will have a beneficial effect on some other parts of the body or to improve general health.
Sway unsteadily, reel, or totter.
Doubt, waver, be shocked.
Have multiple groups doing the same thing in a uniform fashion, but starting at different, evenly-spaced, times or places (attested from 1856).
Astonished, taken aback.
Arranged in a way that is not uniform.
definitions.example: The U.S. Senate holds staggered elections, with only one third of the seats being filled every two years.

definitions.definition: A holy war undertaken by Muslims.
An aggressive campaign for an idea.
A personal spiritual struggle for self-improvement and/or against evil.
To participate in a jihad.
An ancient kind of brooch used to hold clothing together, similar in function to the modern safety pin.
The smaller of the two bones in the lower leg, the calf bone.
A syllabic sound.
Of, relating to, or consisting of a syllable or syllables.
Pronounced with every syllable distinct.
Designating a sound that is or can be the most sonorant segment of a syllable, as a vowel or a resonant. In the word riddle ([ɹɪdl̩]), the two syllabic sounds are [ɪ] and [l̩].
Of, or being a form of verse, based on the number of syllables in a line rather than on the arrangement of accents or quantities.
An unconventional badly-behaved person who causes embarrassment or shock to others.
An unusually successful person who is strikingly unorthodox, innovative, and/or avant-garde.
A cost of business which does not vary with output or sales; an overhead.
definitions.example: Our fixed costs are too high.

definitions.definition: A worker who makes rounds, especially in order to deliver goods.
A policeman who acts as inspector.
A small square piece of rich cake, usually made with chocolate.
A mythical creature, a helpful elf who would secretly do people's housework for them.
A household spirit or revered ancestor.
Any of various lycaenid butterflies of the Eurasian genus Miletus.
A brown trout (Salmo trutta).
A tall, long-necked beer bottle, made from brown coloured glass.
A person of Arab, Indian or Hispanic descent. Also rarely used for a Native American or Pacific Islander.
A girl in the first level of girl scouts.
A state, arousal, or thing describable by wonder, strange, awe, surprise, marvel, or astonishment.
A puzzle or curiosity.
A writer and creator of theatrical plays.

Something assumed without proof as being self-evident or generally accepted, especially when used as a basis for an argument. Sometimes distinguished from axioms as being relevant to a particular science or context, rather than universally true, and following from other axioms rather than being an absolute assumption.
A fundamental element; a basic principle.
An axiom.
A requirement; a prerequisite.
To assume as a truthful or accurate premise or axiom, especially as a basis of an argument.
To appoint or request one's appointment to an ecclesiastical office.
To request, demand or claim for oneself.
Postulated.
A partially free peasant of a low hereditary class, attached like a slave to the land owned by a feudal lord and required to perform labour, enjoying minimal legal or customary rights
A similar agricultural labourer in 18th and 19th century Europe
(strategy games) a worker unit
A sharp protective spine of a plant.
Any shrub or small tree that bears thorns, especially a hawthorn.
definitions.example: the cockspur thorn

definitions.definition: That which pricks or annoys; anything troublesome.

A letter of Latin script (capital: Þ, small: þ), borrowed from the futhark; today used only in Icelandic to represent the voiceless dental fricative, but originally used in several early Germanic scripts, including Old English where it represented the dental fricatives that are today written th (Old English did not have phonemic voicing distinctions for fricatives).
To pierce with, or as if with, a thorn
Mildly risqué.
definitions.example: She wore a racy dress that was just barely appropriate for the occasion.

definitions.definition: Having a strong flavor indicating origin; of distinct characteristic taste; tasting of the soil.
definitions.example: a racy wine

definitions.definition: (by extension) Exciting to the mind by a strong or distinctive character of thought or language; peculiar and piquant; fresh and lively.
Involving a data race or a race condition.
An Arctic mammal, Ovibos moschatus of the Caprinae subfamily of the family Bovidae, having a thick coat and long curved horns.
To confuse and bewilder; to leave speechless.
A device for converting wind power into electricity.
A doctor.
A paramedic, someone with special training in first aid, especially in the military.
A medical student.
Of or pertaining to medicines; medical.
Any of various European and North African herbs, of the genus Medicago, several of which are grown for fodder etc.
Alternative form of Internet of Things
A mongrel dog.
A person of mixed race or ethnicity.
The highest belt colour in various martial arts.
Someone who has attained the black belt in martial arts.
definitions.example: Raymond is a black belt in karate.

definitions.definition: Great skill in any field.
A senior manager who is expert in one of various management systems such as Six Sigma or DMAIC and acts in a project leader or mentor role.
(southern) A geographic region where the residents are predominantly or exclusively African-American.
To transmit in succession, as from father to son, or from predecessor to successor.
definitions.example: Fables are handed down from age to age.

definitions.definition: To deliver (the decision of a court, etc.)
definitions.example: The jury handed down a verdict of guilty.

definitions.definition: To forward to the proper officer (the decision of a higher court).
definitions.example: The Clerk of the Court of Appeals handed down its decision.

definitions.definition: To donate (as second hand.)
definitions.example: When my older brother grows out of his clothes, he hands them down to me.

definitions.definition: One or more merchant ships sailing in company to the same general destination under the protection of naval vessels.
A group of vehicles travelling together for safety, especially one with an escort.
The act of convoying; protection.
To escort a group of vehicles, and provide protection.
definitions.example: A frigate convoys a merchantman.

definitions.definition: Someone who interferes with others; one who is nosy, intrusive or meddlesome.
A light, brisk musical movement; a gigue.

A lively dance in 6/8 (double jig), 9/8 (slip jig) or 12/8 (single jig) time; a tune suitable for such a dance. By extension, a lively traditional tune in any of these time signatures. Unqualified, the term is usually taken to refer to a double (6/8) jig.
definitions.example: They danced a jig.

definitions.definition: (traditional English Morris dancing) A dance performed by one or sometimes two individual dancers, as opposed to a dance performed by a set or team.
A type of lure consisting of a hook molded into a weight, usually with a bright or colorful body.

A device in manufacturing, woodworking, or other creative endeavors for controlling the location, path of movement, or both of either a workpiece or the tool that is operating upon it. Subsets of this general class include machining jigs, woodworking jigs, welders' jigs, jewelers' jigs, and many others.
definitions.example: Cutting circles out of pinewood is best done with a compass-style jig.

definitions.definition: An apparatus or machine for jigging ore.
A light, humorous piece of writing, especially in rhyme; a farce in verse; a ballad.
A trick; a prank.
To move briskly, especially as a dance.
definitions.example: The guests were jigging around on the dance floor.

definitions.definition: To move with a skip or rhythm; to move with vibrations or jerks.
To fish with a jig.
To sing to the tune of a jig.
To trick or cheat; to cajole; to delude.
To sort or separate, as ore in a jigger or sieve.
To cut or form, as a piece of metal, in a jigging machine.
A black person.
In a rigorous manner.
Wooden framework on which persons are put to death by hanging.
A wretch who deserves to be hanged.
The rest for the tympan when raised.
Suspenders; braces.
Any contrivance with posts and crossbeam for suspending objects.
The main frame of a beam engine.
To frighten or terrify.
A state of nature; conformity to nature.
The doctrine that denies a supernatural agency in the miracles and revelations recorded in religious texts and in spiritual influences.
Any system of philosophy which refers the phenomena of nature as a blind force or forces acting necessarily or according to fixed laws, excluding origination or direction by a will.
A doctrine which denies a strong separation between scientific and philosophic methodologies and/or topics

A movement in theatre, film, and literature that seeks to replicate a believable everyday reality, as opposed to such movements as romanticism or surrealism, in which subjects may receive highly symbolic or idealistic treatment.
Naturism, nudism, social nudity.
To place bias upon; to influence.
definitions.example: Our prejudices bias our views.

definitions.definition: Exhibiting bias; prejudiced.
definitions.example: The newspaper gave a biased account of the incident.

definitions.definition: Angled at a slant.
definitions.example: The table had a biased edge.

definitions.definition: On which an electrical bias is applied.
Exhibiting a systematic distortion of results due to a factor not allowed for in its derivation; skewed.
A graph in the form of boxes of different heights, with each box representing a different value or category of data, and the heights representing frequencies.
Having freckles; covered with freckles.
definitions.example: A smile grew across Jim's freckled face.

definitions.definition: To leave out or omit (something).
To cut off, as a vowel or a syllable.
To conflate; to smear together; to blur the distinction between.
A dilapidated neighborhood where many people live in a state of poverty.
Inexpensive trinkets awarded as prizes in a carnival game.
To visit a neighborhood of a status below one's own.
Slumgullion; a meat-based stew
To turn aside or away.
definitions.example: To avert the eyes from an object.

definitions.definition: To ward off, or prevent, the occurrence or effects of.
definitions.example: How can the danger be averted?

definitions.definition: To turn away.
To turn away.
A prepackaged, fresh or frozen meal that only requires heating (often in a microwave) before being served, sometimes in its own packaging.
The dominion of an Elector in the Holy Roman Empire.
The collective people of a country, state, or electoral district who are entitled to vote.
definitions.example: The votes have been counted and the electorate has spoken.

definitions.definition: The geographic area encompassing an electoral district.
definitions.example: The electorate of Finchley borders on the electorate of Much-Binding-in-the-Marsh, splitting the new housing estate of Royal Cupolas.

definitions.definition: A building where beer is produced.
A company that brews beer.
Any musical instrument that produces sound when air flows through it; a reed instrument or brass instrument.
Severe overheating of the core of a nuclear reactor resulting in the core melting and radiation escaping.
definitions.example: Four years have passed since the meltdown at the Chernobyl nuclear plant, but the grim legacy of the Soviet catastrophe is still unfolding. https//web.archive.org/web/20041130094534/http://www.time.com/time/daily/chernobyl/chernobyl.index.html

definitions.definition: A situation being likened to a nuclear meltdown; a crisis.
definitions.example: Computer engineers were at a loss last night to explain why the Government had been hit by arguably the worst electronic meltdown in the history of Whitehall. https//web.archive.org/web/20041209011615/http://news.independent.co.uk/uk/politics/story.jsp?story=587262

definitions.definition: A tantrum.
A person who prints or binds books.
A person who compiles books from the writings of others.
A person (or a business) who calculates odds and accepts bets, especially on horse racing; a bookie.
A cabin that protrudes above a ship's deck.
An amount added to a bill in a restaurant, or other similar establishment, which is normally paid to the waiter or waitress.
A fee charged for a service, typically to cover administration or processing costs.
A non-alcoholic carbonated beverage.
(of a liquid) Containing bubbles.
Lively, vivacious.
Makes a hissing sound.
Any mail or letters that are not welcome or solicited and typically sent in bulk; especially mail of a commercial nature such as advertising circulars and form letters.
To vet or evaluate; to criticize or correct, often by hindsight, by presuming to have a better idea, method, etc.
definitions.example: Once she began listening to her instincts and didn't second-guess herself the entire time, her artwork improved noticeably.

definitions.definition: To anticipate or predict someone's actions or thoughts by guesswork.
A fortified wine produced in Jerez de la Frontera in Spain, or a similar wine produced elsewhere.
A variety of sherry.
definitions.example: They produce several quality sherries.

definitions.definition: A glass of sherry.
definitions.example: Would you like a sherry?

definitions.definition: An impulsive, hasty, capricious person.
An insane person, a lunatic.
Impulsive, hasty or reckless; capricious.
definitions.example: The film featured a madcap car chase that went right through a crowded café.

definitions.definition: A journalist who uses photojournalism.
(sometimes offensive) a person who has severely impaired physical abilities because of deformation, injury, or amputation of parts of the body.
definitions.example: He returned from war a cripple.

definitions.definition: A shortened wooden stud or brace used to construct the portion of a wall above a door or above and below a window.
Scrapple.
(among lumbermen) A rocky shallow in a stream.
To make someone a cripple; to cause someone to become physically impaired
definitions.example: The car bomb crippled five passers-by.

definitions.definition: To damage seriously; to destroy
definitions.example: My ambitions were crippled by a lack of money.

definitions.definition: To release a product (especially a computer program) with reduced functionality, in some cases, making the item essentially worthless.
definitions.example: The word processor was released in a crippled demonstration version that did not allow you to save.

definitions.definition: To nerf something which is overpowered
Crippled.
Cyanistes caeruleus, a small bird of the tit family Paridae, with an azure blue crown and dark blue line passing through the eye and encircling the white cheeks to the chin.
A board used for serving cheeses.
Confused or unintelligible speech.
To talk fast, idly, foolishly, or without meaning.
To utter inarticulate sounds with rapidity.
definitions.example: gabbling fowls

definitions.definition: Of, relating to, or having melody.
Melodious, tuneful.
To burn the surface of, to scorch.
definitions.example: The sun today could parch cement.

definitions.definition: To roast, as dry grain.
To dry to extremity; to shrivel with heat.
definitions.example: The patient's mouth is parched from fever.

definitions.definition: To make thirsty.
definitions.example: We're parched, hon. Could you send up an ale from the cooler?

definitions.definition: To boil something slowly (Still used in Lancashire in parched peas, a type of mushy peas).
To become superficially burnt; be become sunburned.
definitions.example: The locals watched, amused, as the tourists parched in the sun, having neglected to apply sunscreen or bring water.

definitions.definition: Dry.
Very thirsty.
To make threats against (someone); to intimidate.
definitions.example: to menace a country with war

definitions.definition: To threaten (an evil to be inflicted).
To endanger (someone or something); to imperil or jeopardize.
The act of making menaces or threats.
Suggesting imminent harm.
Threatening.
A percentage, a proportion (especially per hundred).
definitions.example: only a small percent attain the top ranks

definitions.definition: One part per hundred; one percent.
A part of a larger whole, usually in such a form that it is able to be separated from other parts.
definitions.example: I’d like another piece of pie.

definitions.definition: A single item belonging to a class of similar items
definitions.example: a piece of machinery

definitions.definition: One of the figures used in playing chess, specifically a higher-value figure as distinguished from a pawn; by extension, a similar counter etc. in other games.
A coin, especially one valued at less than the principal unit of currency.
definitions.example: a sixpenny piece

definitions.definition: An artistic creation, such as a painting, sculpture, musical composition, literary work, etc.
definitions.example: She played two beautiful pieces on the piano.

definitions.definition: An article published in the press.
definitions.example: Today's paper has an interesting piece on medical research.

definitions.definition: An artillery gun.
A gun.
definitions.example: He's packin' a piece!

definitions.definition: (short for hairpiece) A toupee or wig, especially when worn by a man.
definitions.example: The announcer is wearing a new piece.

definitions.definition: A slice or other quantity of bread, eaten on its own; a sandwich or light snack.
A sexual encounter; from piece of ass or piece of tail
definitions.example: I got a piece at lunchtime.

definitions.definition: (mildly, short for piece of crap/piece of shit) A shoddy or worthless object (usually applied to consumer products like vehicles or appliances).
definitions.example: Ugh, my new computer is such a piece. I'm taking it back to the store tomorrow.

definitions.definition: A cannabis pipe.
Used to describe a pitch that has been hit but not well, usually either being caught by the opposing team or going foul. Usually used in the past tense with got.
definitions.example: he got a piece of that one;  she got a piece of the ball [...] and it's going foul.

definitions.definition: (sometimes derogatory) An individual; a person.
A castle; a fortified building.
A pacifier; a dummy.
A distance.
definitions.example: a fair piece off

definitions.definition: A structured practice row, often used for performance evaluation.
definitions.example: At practice we rowed four 5,000 meter pieces.

definitions.definition: An amount of work to be done at one time; a unit of piece work.
A rectangular piece of thick paper or thin cardboard intended to be written on and mailed without an envelope. In the case of a picture postcard one side carries a picture or photograph.
A forked bone between the neck and breast of a bird consisting chiefly of the two clavicles fused at their median or lower end, regarded as a lucky charm in some countries.
A spar in two parts, between which a sail is hoisted, the wishbone extending its clew.
Any sailing vessel rigged with a wishbone.
A particular kind of offensive formation. See wishbone formation.
An interception of a radio broadcast or a telephone call.
An interception of a missile.
The coordinate of the point at which a curve intersects an axis.
A form of market research where consumers are intercepted and interviewed in a retail store or mall.
To stop, deflect or divert (something in progress or motion).
definitions.example: The police intercepted the package of stolen goods while it was in transit.

definitions.definition: To gain possession of (the ball) in a ball game
To take or comprehend between.
The guinea fowl (family Numididae).
A bird in the genus Meleagris with a fan-shaped tail and wattled neck, especially the wild turkey (Meleagris gallopavo, now domesticated).
The flesh or meat of this bird eaten as food.
definitions.example: All week after Thanksgiving, I had turkey sandwiches for lunch.

definitions.definition: With a distinguishing word: a bird resembling the Meleagris gallopavo (for example, the bush turkey or brush turkey (Alectura lathami), and the water turkey (Anhinga anhinga)).
An act of throwing three strikes in a row.
A patient feigning symptoms; a person faking illness or injury; a malingerer.
A pack carried by a lumberman; a bindle; also, a large travel bag, a suitcase.
A failure.
definitions.example: That film was a turkey.

definitions.definition: (usually mildly) A foolish or inept person.
definitions.example: The turkey cut in front of me and then berated me for running into him.

definitions.definition: Resembling, or characteristic of a gimmick.
Containing gimmicks.
The act of humiliating or humbling someone; abasement of pride; mortification.
The state of being humiliated, humbled or reduced to lowliness or submission.
A shake, quiver, or vibration.
To shake, quiver, or vibrate.
definitions.example: Her lip started to tremble as she burst into tears

definitions.definition: To fear; to be afraid.
The complete genetic information (either DNA or, in some viruses, RNA) of an organism.
A partial covering for a floor.
A (usually thick) piece of fabric used for warmth (especially on a bed); a blanket.
A kind of coarse, heavy frieze, formerly used for clothing.
A cloak or mantle made of such a frieze.
A person wearing a rug.
A cloth covering for a horse.
A dense layer of natural vegetation that precludes the growth of crops.
The female pubic hair.
A rough, woolly, or shaggy dog.
A wig; a hairpiece.
A dense growth of chest hair.
To pull roughly or hastily; to plunder; to spoil; to tear.
Snug; cosy
Containing or producing carbon.
A point or place where a check is performed, especially a point along a road or on a frontier where travellers are stopped for inspection
definitions.example: The travellers were stopped at the checkpoint.

definitions.definition: A situation, often represented by a point in time, at which the state of a database system is known to be valid, and to which it can be returned in the event of a crisis by using a combination of backups and logs; the data stored at this event.
A predetermined point in a map, level or scenario that the player may resume from if they die or restart from if they choose to.
definitions.example: You can't finish the race if you haven't passed all of the checkpoints on the track.

definitions.definition: To set a checkpoint.
A drinking establishment where only wine is served.
The act of negating something.
A denial or contradiction.

A proposition which is the contradictory of another proposition and which can be obtained from that other proposition by the appropriately placed addition/insertion of the word "not". (Or, in symbolic logic, by prepending that proposition with the symbol for the logical operator "not".)
The logical operation which obtains such (negated) propositions.
To do a belly flop; to fall flat on one's face.
To fail miserably; to make a huge mistake; to fall flat on one's face.
